item.title: Rubbish outside number 50 William Barefoot Drive SE9 3JD., 27th September
item.description:
This house’s rubbish hasn’t been collected since they moved in to this address in May. Not sure if they know the rules about recycling. Foxes are constantly ripping the bags open and the rubbish is spread all down the road. It’s attracting mice and grown men are urinating up against the bin. It stinks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, William Barefoot Drive, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground in bad state, 27th September
item.description:
The playground has been so outdated and dangerous for such a long time now. It needs new surfacing, new play equipment. I have attached photos of the broken play equipment and the floor state the kids are tripping over and hurting themselves constantly. It’s not safe enough and children and the community would really enjoy an updated playground especially this one as there’s not many playgrounds around for the kids in Crayford. Please can something be done about it. Someone needs to come and do a risk assessment and really take a close look on how dangerous it is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Adopted K6 phone box, 27th September
item.description:
One of these phone boxes belongs to BT and they are in the process of fixing and cleaning up the kiosk. The other kiosk next to it was adopted by Thinking out of the box and they have long gone out business. BT runs a very sneaky campaign which offloads phone boxes like this one and they become void of any responsibility of it. BT told me to contact the local council for this one. As you can see it is covered in stickers,flyposters and graffiti. It doesn't make sense only one kiosk getting a makeover as it just encourages and attracts more. BT have already cleaned the operational phone box this year but will be coming to do a deep clean,repaint and fixing the phone line as its not working. I've asked if they can do something about the lighting as this will deter misuse of the kiosk. So can you please clean off this mess on the abandoned adopted kiosk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belvedere Road, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
